author: starball5
text:
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes



VS Code Version: 1.97.2
OS Version: Ubuntu 24.10

Steps to Reproduce:

Open a JS document
Type "//".at
Put the cursor before the .
Press enter
Observe that it started a comment
Do the same thing with a comma instead of a dot

This is actually disruptive. Ex. fetch requests, which have URL as the first argument. Trying to retroactively split the rest to a new line by pressing enter now puts the right side in a commented line.
Historically related: #26694

author: RGHenderson
text:
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes



VS Code Version: 1.97.2
OS Version: Linux X64 6.9.3-76060903-generic

Steps to Reproduce:

Create a VSCode extension with an localised description and command title (or install from the marketplace)
Install the extension, and view that neither the extension description or command title use the localised string, nor does it fail to load a string - the english/default version is used.
See screenshot below with pseudo-localised language pack enabled

author: Mon-ius
text: current vscode support local -> remote, and remote -> remote if they are same machine, however, it not support from remote to local and remote to remote if they are not same machine, it last for many years, hope such feature can be added, so that we can save a lot of time to manual download the file from remote, open it then copy the content to local.

author: c-claeys
text:
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes


Following up on #239227, sorry for the lag.
In short:
I think the MappedEditsResult here should have a ChatResult. The InlineChatController's reviewEdits method is simulating a Chat Participant, so this seems like a natural place to internally add this new property.
To answer the question from that other issue

Can you elaborate more?
What would the UI do with the ChatResult it gets back from provideMappedEdits?

Chat participants may subscribe to onDidPerformAction events today. When a mapped edit provider provides some edits, it receives the relevant ChatResult with the provider callback today. When the mapped edit provider returns its edits, the subscribed participant will receive an event with a ChatResult. However, this ChatResult is the earlier one which the mapped edit provider receives and is IMO stale. Instead, the mapped edit provider should be able to return a ChatResult which is later returned with the given action.
I believe this would require changes to inlineChatSession.ts, inlineChatController.ts, andcodeBlockOperations.ts in particular.
Please let me know if you're open to PRs, if this isn't clear, or if you're not interested in such changes.
Thanks!

author: Prakhargupta34
text:
Problem
Currently, when using the Microsoft Authentication extension in remote environments like code-server, users are required to manually copy and paste an authorization code to log in. This can be cumbersome and error-prone.
Proposal
Introduce the LocalServerFlow in Microsoft Authentication extension so that the user won't have to copy-paste the authorization code when running in the remove environment like code-server.
Implementation details
The idea is to introduce the new LocalServerFlow which will use the new LocalServerLoopbackClient that will spin up the http server and listen for the Auth Code and once received it will login the user to the account. We can maybe take the redirectURI as part of scope string.
The msal-node library already have this loopback client implementation, but there is now way to pass the redirect URI from outside, so maybe we can take reference from there and modify it accordingly and pass it.
In remote environment like code-server, there is the port forwarding feature and can get the proxy URI with this env variable(VSCODE_PROXY_URI)
Benefits
Simplified login: No more manual copy-pasting of codes.
Better experience for remote environments: Makes the login process seamless in code-server and similar setups.
